```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(stringr)

student_depression_dataset$id <- NULL
student_depression_dataset$`Work Pressure` <- NULL
student_depression_dataset$`Job Satisfaction` <- NULL
student_depression_dataset$Profession <- NULL

table(student_depression_dataset$Degree)

names(student_depression_dataset)



# Assuming your dataset is named 'df'
academic_level_categorized <- student_depression_dataset |>
  mutate(
    Academic_Level = case_when(
      # 1. PhD Level
      str_detect(Degree, "PhD") ~ "PhD",
      
      # 2. Master's / Professional Level (Degrees starting with M or LLM/MD)
      str_detect(Degree, "^M") | Degree %in% c("LLM", "MD") ~ "Master's/Professional",
      
      # 3. Bachelor's Level (Degrees starting with B or LLB/MBBS)
      str_detect(Degree, "^B") | Degree %in% c("LLB", "MBBS") ~ "Bachelor's",
      
      # 4. High School Level
      Degree == "Class 12" ~ "High School",
      
      # 5. Catch remaining (like "Others")
      TRUE ~ "Other"
    )
  )

# Verify the new categorization (Counts how many records fall into each new category)
academic_level_categorized |>
  count(Academic_Level, sort = TRUE)
```
